Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Friday November 28), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for friday, november 28th.

amazon is launching a new satellite internet service, aiming to compete with elon musk's starlink. the service, part of amazon's project kuiper, plans to offer global internet coverage by deploying over 3,000 satellites. the company has already secured major partnerships to boost production and intends to start launching satellites next year.

in a significant move for cybersecurity, google has announced its latest initiative to combat ransomware attacks. the tech giant is rolling out a suite of advanced security tools targeted at protecting businesses from increasingly sophisticated cyber threats. google's vice president of security stated that these tools aim to provide comprehensive protection, especially for small to medium enterprises vulnerable to cyberattacks.

shares of meta platforms are on the rise today as the company reported better-than-expected earnings for the quarter. with increased user engagement and advertising revenue surpassing analysts' predictions, meta continues to show resilience amid economic uncertainties. the company also highlighted its forward-looking investments in the metaverse, which ceo mark zuckerberg believes will be crucial for future growth.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for friday, november 28th.

amazon is setting its sights on the satellite internet market, aiming to go head-to-head with elon musk's starlink. through its ambitious project kuiper, amazon plans to deploy over 3,000 satellites to achieve global internet coverage. they've already secured crucial partnerships to ramp up production and intend to start launching satellites next year. this move marks a significant expansion for the tech giant as it ventures into space-based connectivity.

turning to cybersecurity, google is stepping up its game against ransomware. the tech titan has unveiled a new suite of advanced security tools designed to shield businesses from increasingly sophisticated cyber threats. google's vp of security has emphasized that these tools are focused on offering comprehensive protection for small to medium-sized enterprises, which are often the most vulnerable targets for cyberattacks.

in the stock market, shares of meta platforms are climbing today. the company reported quarterly earnings that exceeded analysts' expectations, driven by strong user engagement and higher-than-anticipated ad revenue. despite economic uncertainties, meta has demonstrated resilience and highlighted its ongoing investments in the metaverse. ceo mark zuckerberg believes these investments will be pivotal for future growth.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-420 Amazon's Satellite Ambitions 🚀, Google's Ransomware Defense 🛡️, Meta's Earnings Surge 📈
Podcast Description:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for friday, november 28th:

  • amazon's satellite internet ambitions: launching project kuiper with plans for over 3,000 satellites to compete with starlink, marking amazon’s foray into space-based connectivity.
  • google's anti-ransomware initiative: release of advanced security tools to protect small to medium-sized businesses from sophisticated cyber threats.
  • meta platforms' stock surge: shares rise following quarterly earnings that beat expectations; driven by strong user engagement and ad revenue. continue to bet on metaverse for future growth.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow.
